intro: Juttadinteria, commonly known as the desert rose or false rose, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. These succulent plants are characterized by their fleshy, spiny stems and showy, often pink or red flowers. They are adapted to arid environments, storing water in their thick leaves and stems. Juttadinteria species typically bloom in summer, adding vibrant color to their harsh habitats. Their unique appearance and resilience make them popular in xeriscaping and rock gardens.
